GPIO Driver How to

int eddy_gpio_ioctl (struct inode *inode, struct file *flip, unsigned int command, unsigned long arg)
 ioctl

Detailed Description

Cit200 gpio driver provide a way to control gpio from userspace. The driver support open,close,ioctl function.
Gate1：Eddy GPIO 1/Output  	GPIO1-->PC16 (offset:1)
Gate2：Eddy GPIO 3/Output  	GPIO3-->PC18 (offset:3)
Gate3：Eddy GPIO 5/Input		GPIO5-->PC20 (offset:5)
Gate4：Eddy GPIO 7/Input		GPIO7-->PC22 (offset:7)
				GPIO11 --> PC26(offset:11)
				PID1   --> PC7 (offset:18)
You need create the device file node 
#mknod  /dev/gpio c 99 0

Typedef Documentation

GPIO param struct.

int eddy_gpio_ioctl ( struct inode *  inode,
struct file *  flip,
unsigned int  command,
unsigned long  arg 
)

ioctl

Parameters:
[in] inode struct inode *
[in] flip struct file *
[in] command 0x5510 ~ 0x5513
  • 0x5510 set gpio mode input = 0 output = 1
  • 0x5511 get gpio mode
  • 0x5512 set gpio value high = 1 low = 0
  • 0x5513 get gpio value
[in] arg parameter pass from userspace
Returns:
int
  • <0: erro
  • >0: success
  • Example: 
    #define SETGPIOMODE     0x5510  //set gpio mode input = 0 output = 1 
#define GETGPIOMODE     0x5511  //get gpio mode
#define SETGPIOVALUE    0x5512  //set gpio value high = 1 low = 0 
#define GETGPIOVALUE    0x5513  //get gpio value 

#define GPIO1 1
#define GPIO3 3
#define GPIO5 5
#define GPIO7 7
#define GPIO11 11
#define PID1 18

#define GPIO_OUT 1
#define GPIO_IN  0
#define GPIO_HIGH 1
#define GPIO_LOW  0

typedef struct _GPIO_PARAM
{
        int pin_offset;                         
        int pin_mode;
        int pin_value;
} GPIO_PARAM;

int main(int argc,char *argv[])
{
        int fd,result;
        GPIO_PARAM  gpio = { GPIO1,GPIO_OUT,GPIO_HIGH};

        fd = open("/dev/gpio", O_RDWR); 
        if (fd < 0){ 
                printf("open dev fail !\n");
                return -1;
        }

        // set gpio1 output mode 
        if ((result = ioctl(fd, SETGPIOMODE, &gpio)) == -1) {
                printf("IOCTL: GPIO_IOGS failed: SETGPIOMODE\n");
                return -1;
        }
        
        //set gpio1 output 1
        if ((result = ioctl(fd, SETGPIOVALUE, &gpio)) == -1) {
                printf("IOCTL: GPIO _IOGS failed: SETGPIOVALUEHIGH\n");
                return -1;
        }

        //read gpio1 mode status
        if ((result = ioctl(fd, GETGPIOMODE, &gpio)) == -1) {
                printf("IOCTL: GPIO _IOGS failed: GETGPIOMODE \n");
                return -1;
        }
        
        //read gpio1 value status
        if ((result = ioctl(fd, GETGPIOVALUE, &gpio)) == -1) {
                printf("IOCTL: GPIO _IOGS failed: GETGPIOVALUE\n");
                return -1;
        }
    close(fd);
        return 0;
}
